articles.description: A 10-minute jog might feel like a cop-out, but a new study by the Stanford University School of Medicine has found that it’s enough to alter 9,815 molecules in your body.
articles.content:
• A new study found that 9,815 molecules changed after a quick workout on the treadmill.
  • The study authors think in the future, people may be able to take a blood test to determin… [+2953 chars]

articles.author: Helen Sullivan, Josh Halliday, Damien Gayle, Nadeem Badshah, Fiona Harvey, Kim Willsher, Kenya Evelyn, 	 Antonia Wilson, Severin Carrell, Philip Oltermann, Akhtar Mohammad Makoii, Kate Proctor, Oliver Milman, Christopher Knaus, Maanvi Singh
articles.title: Coronavirus live news: Bahrain says 44% of asymptomatic cases are infectious - The Guardian
articles.description: Asymptomatic carriers in Bahrain found to pose a risk; shortage of test kits ‘leading to virus spread in Africa’; Mexico confirms record daily infections
